technical-data.invention-title: SELBSTRAGENDES BAUMODUL FÜR DIE KONSTRUKTION VON STAHLBETONPLATTEN
SELF-SUPPORTING CONSTRUCTION MODULE, FOR THE CONSTRUCTION OF REINFORCED-CONCRETE SLABS
MODULE DE CONSTRUCTION AUTOPORTEUR POUR LA CONSTRUCTION DE DALLES EN BÉTON ARMÉ

address.street: Barzanò & Zanardo Milano S.p.A. Corso Vittorio Emanuele II, 61

abstract.p: Self-supporting construction module, for the construction of reinforced-concrete slabs, comprising a substantially parallelepiped body or plate (2) in which along at least one longitudinal direction of the plate itself is defined at least one groove (3) for its entire length. Such plates have a mutually united shape, in order to associate a plurality of plates one to the other, such as to form a complete slab structure, formed by a plurality of such modules. The module comprises a longitudinal reinforcing element (6), which is inserted in longitudinal slots (7) extending for the entire length of the body, such slots having a variable width in order to ease the insertion of mutually aligned modules of the longitudinal reinforcing element and, in the meantime, in order to guarantee the keeping of such reinforcements inside the module.

Self-supporting construction module, for the construction of reinforced-concrete slabs, comprising a substantially parallelepiped body or plate (2) in which along at least one longitudinal direction of the plate itself is defined at least one groove (3) for its entire length. Such plates have a mutually united shape, in order to associate a plurality of plates one to the other, such as to form a complete slab structure, formed by a plurality of such modules. The module comprises a longitudinal reinforcing element (6), which is inserted in longitudinal slots (7) extending for the entire length of the body, such slots having a variable width in order to ease the insertion of mutually aligned modules of the longitudinal reinforcing element and, in the meantime, in order to guarantee the keeping of such reinforcements inside the module.

Cette invention concerne un module de construction autoporteur pour la construction de dalles en béton armé, comprenant un corps ou plaque sensiblement parallélépipède (2), au moins une rainure (3) étant définie sur toute la longueur de ladite plaque, dans au moins un sens longitudinal de celle-ci. Lesdites plaques sont de forme identique de façon à permettre l'association mutuelle d'une pluralité de plaques pour former une structure de dalle entière, constituée d'une pluralité de tels modules. Le module de l'invention comprend en outre un élément longitudinal d'armature (6) qui est inséré dans les fentes longitudinales (7) qui s'étendent sur toute la longueur du corps, lesdites fentes étant de largeur variable afin de faciliter l'insertion de modules mutuellement alignés de l'élément d'armature longitudinal et pour garantir le maintien desdits éléments d'armature dans le module.

Cette invention concerne un module de construction autoporteur pour la construction de dalles en béton armé, comprenant un corps ou plaque sensiblement parallélépipède (2), au moins une rainure (3) étant définie sur toute la longueur de ladite plaque, dans au moins un sens longitudinal de celle-ci. Lesdites plaques sont de forme identique de façon à permettre l'association mutuelle d'une pluralité de plaques pour former une structure de dalle entière, constituée d'une pluralité de tels modules. Le module de l'invention comprend en outre un élément longitudinal d'armature (6) qui est inséré dans les fentes longitudinales (7) qui s'étendent sur toute la longueur du corps, lesdites fentes étant de largeur variable afin de faciliter l'insertion de modules mutuellement alignés de l'élément d'armature longitudinal et pour garantir le maintien desdits éléments d'armature dans le module.

description.p: DESCRIPTION
Title: "SELF-SUPPORTING CONSTRUCTION MODULE, FOR THE CONSTRUCTION OF REINFORCED-CONCRETE SLABS" .

In its general aspect, the present invention refers to a self-supporting construction module adapted for the construction of reinforced-concrete slabs, which can be made of a plurality of panels made from a plastic or cardboard material, which are joined together with connection means to form a slab, on which concrete is cast so as to form the actual reinforced-concrete plane .
For the purposes of the present invention by slab we mean that structure which is used to create the ceiling of the rooms positioned below it and the floor of the rooms positioned above it.
The slabs can be made of various types of materials, wood, iron, reinforced-concrete etc...

As it is known, in the field of building constructions, construction modules made from expanded plastic material are used, preferably made from expanded polystyrene, in the form of boards or profiles with suitable shapes and dimensions, having the function of thermal insulation. It is also known that in order to confer suitable self-supporting characteristics to said constructive modules it is necessary to incorporate or insert in the mass of plastic material one or more reinforcement profiles made from metal, or wood, plastic material or in any case other rigid material, that is suitably shaped.
One slab of such a type is described in the Italian patent application PN2008A000092 which describes a self-supporting construction module comprising a substantially parallelepiped- shaped plate, having a lower surface that is substantially smooth and in which along at least one of the two longitudinal or transverse directions of the plate itself at least a cavity or recess is defined in which at least one longitudinal reinforcement element is inserted. In said recesses constraint elements for a false-ceiling or for similar elements are inserted.

In general, the longitudinal reinforcing elements are inserted in longitudinal slots made with suitable dimensions. This, however, often implies that the insertion operations of said reinforcements are difficult, due to the friction between the walls of the slots and the reinforcement itself. On the other hand, if the slots are too wide, the reinforcement can move and not achieve its strengthening purpose.

The present invention proposes to avoid the aforementioned drawbacks, while at the same time improving also the strength or self-supporting characteristics of a structure formed by a plurality of modules, in which in each module there is the presence of longitudinal slots in which profiles are inserted which longitudinally cross each module and are inserted in each following module for the entire length of the structure formed.

The slots have variable width so as to ease the insertion of mutually aligned modules of the longitudinal reinforcing element and, in the meantime, to guarantee the keeping of said reinforcements inside
the module. In particular, during the insertion inside the module, each slot has a width that is greater than the thickness of the reinforcement so as to ease the insertion, whereas in its intermediate portions and/or also near the outlet it has a width that substantially corresponds to the thickness of the reinforcement, so as to hold it, bonding it inside the module.

In such a way the profiles are sufficiently constrained to the panels, determining the balanced strengthening of the structure itself and at the same time avoiding movement of the panels with respect to the profiles. One aspect of the present invention concerns a self- supporting construction module having the characteristics of the attached claim 1.

The characteristics and the advantages of the self- supporting construction module according to the present invention shall be highlighted by the following description, given as an example and not for limiting purposes, given with reference to the attached figures, in which:
- figure 1 shows two construction modules bonded to one another according to the present invention;
- figure 2a shows a front view of the module according to the present invention;
- figure 2b shows an enlarged detail of figure 2a;
- figure 3a shows a side view of the modules of figure 1;
- figure 3b shows a side and partially section view of the modules of figure 1 ;

- figure 3c shows a longitudinal section of the modules of figure 1, taken along the plane B-B
indicated in figure 2a;
- figure 3d shows an enlarged detail of figure 3b
- figure 4 shows a top view of the modules of figure 1;
- figures 5a and 5b show a perspective view and a side view of a constraint element of the modules of figure 1, respectively;
- figure 6 shows the modules of figure 1, which have elements for increasing the thickness positioned above .
- figure 7a shows a front view of a module according to a second embodiment of the present invention,

- figure 7b is an enlarged detail of figure 7a. With reference to the mentioned figures the self- supporting construction module according to the present invention comprises a substantially parallelepiped- shaped body or plate 2 , for example made of an expanded plastic material, like expanded polystyrene, having a substantially flat lower surface and in which at least one groove 3 is defined, preferably obtained on the upper surface and along at least one of the two directions, longitudinal or transversal, of the plate itself. Preferably, the construction module moreover, on the rear and front surfaces 4 and 5 of the plate, is equipped with protrusions 41 and seats 51, having a mutually united shape, so as to be able to associate a plurality of plates one to the other, so as to form a complete slab structure. In an alternative embodiment such protrusions and seats may not be present and the plates are simply rested against one another.
The construction module further comprises at least one longitudinal or transversal reinforcing element 6, which is inserted in longitudinal slots 7 which extend for the entire length of the body.
In particular said slots have a front opening 71 for the insertion of the reinforcing element and a back opening 72for the exit of the reinforcing element itself .

As shown in figures 2a and 2b, inside slots 7 there are longitudinal tightening teeth 73, which have the aim to reduce the width of slot 7, at least in some points. Said teeth, preferably extend for the entire length of slot 7 in order to guarantee the stability of reinforcement 6.

The shape of said slots 7, comprising said teeth 73 is such to ease the insertion in mutually aligned modules of the longitudinal reinforcing element and, in the meantime, to guarantee the keeping of such reinforcements inside the module. Indeed, the shape of the slots makes it possible, during the operations of insertion of the longitudinal reinforcement, to minimize the strain due to friction with the walls of the slot.

By reducing the surface directly in contact with reinforcement 6 only in specific points, it is possible to reduce the friction during the insertion of reinforcement 6 maintaining stable the position of said reinforcement. The use of longitudinal tightening teeth 73 gives the opportunity to make said slots 7 with a rectangular section, easy to make, keeping unchanged the stability of reinforcement 6 In slot7 of reinforcement 6.
It is also possible to make slots 7 with section of a truncated cone.
Moreover, the effects of possible small misalignments at the mouth of the reinforcement can be avoided.

In a second embodiment shown in figures 7a and 7b inside slots 7 there are vertical tightening teeth 74, which have the aim to reduce the width of the slot . Preferably, said teeth 74 extend vertically for the entire height of slot 7. Preferably, in said embodiment, said vertical tightening teeth 74 are positioned only at the entrance of said slot 7, that, also in this case has a rectangular section, easy to make, making it easy to insert said reinforcement end guaranteeing the correct position. Preferably said teeth are either of the same material of body 2 or they are made of an elastic material adapted to lose their shape in order to ease the insertion of reinforcement 6 and match with it in order to guarantee the correct position.
Such a reinforcing element is preferably made from a rigid, metal, wooden or plastic material.
Even more preferably it is made by means of a metal profile .
The reinforcing element 6 advantageously has a "Z", C,
T, I, Ω shape, which are shapes which withstand strong longitudinal stress, which the structure may undergo. Preferably, slot 7 has in section substantially the same shape as reinforcing element 6.

Said slots 7 are preferably but not exclusively formed at protrusions 41 and at seats 51. In such a way, it is
easier to obtain the correspondence between inlet openings and outlet openings in adjacent modules, further easing the insertion of reinforcing element 6 between such two modules.

According to the present invention, in at least one groove 3 of the plate, preferably in each of them, the module comprises bonding elements 8 for a false-ceiling or for similar elements (for example metal elements, which in turn bond with panels of a false-ceiling) .

Said bonding elements, shown in detail in figures 5a and 5b, can be embedded in the groove during the fabrication of plate 2, or inserted in a housing 31 formed on the edge of the groove itself, as shown in the embodiment .

Such bonding elements are essentially made by means of a blade, for example made from metal, comprising at least a "C" -shaped portion 81 and a little vertical plate 82, which extends from one of the horizontal branches of such a "C" shape .

The C-shaped portion and the little plate are preferably made as a single piece, for example by bending of a little metal bar. The C-shaped portion is adapted for receiving inside it the edge of lower groove 2 in aforementioned housing 31.
The small upper plate has holes 83 and remains free inside groove 3 and when concrete is cast on the ceiling structure it creates a stable bond between plates 2 and the concrete itself in groove 3.

Moreover, on the base of such a "C" -shaped portion, there is a little hole 84 adapted for example for the bonding the element with the plate. In such a hole self-tapping screws can be advantageously inserted.
The slab structure is formed by using a plurality of plates 2 that are arranged in series joined together by means of the aforementioned protrusions 4land seats 51 and subsequently held together also through the insertion of the reinforcing elements.

On one of the two front surfaces of a module, at least one recess 21 is formed, for example in the shape of a parallelepiped and on the other a correspondent shape 22 extends, adapted for being inserted in the recess of an adjacent module, which together with protrusions 41 inserted in seats 51 determine the formation of guide means for joining two modules in the correct manner. Such modules can be adjusted in height so as to be able to satisfy different requirements. Indeed, a height adapter 10 having analogous dimensions as those of the module and that reproduces the upper surface, can be associated to each module. In particular, on its upper surface there is a longitudinal dovetail guide 11, corresponding to a longitudinal dovetail guide 23 present on the upper surface of each module. Moreover, on the lower surface of the adapter there is a projecting longitudinal element 12 having a section adapted for fitting in guide 23 of the module or in a guide 11 of another adapter. In such a way, the adapter is bonded to the module and, according to the requirements, one or more adapters can be arranged stacked on every module, so as to be able to vary the overall thickness of the structure as needed. Alternatively, if there are no guides, such adapters can be bonded in another manner to the module, for example glued.
BLANK PAGE

claim.claim-text: 1. Self-supporting construction module, for the construction of reinforced-concrete slabs, comprising
• a substantially parallelepiped body or plate (2) in which in at least one longitudinal direction of the plate itself is defined at least one groove (3) for its entire length,
• such plates having a mutually united shape, in order to associate a plurality of plates one to the other, such as to form a complete slab structure, formed by a plurality of such modules ,
• at least one longitudinal reinforcing element (6) , which is inserted in longitudinal slots (7) extending for the entire length of the body;

such slots having a variable width in order to ease the insertion of mutually aligned modules of the longitudinal reinforcing element and, in the meantime, in order to guarantee the keeping of such reinforcements inside the module;
2characterized by the fact that inside the slots (7) longitudinal tightening teeth (73) are provided, with the aim of reducing the width of the slot in some points of the same.
2. Module according to claim 1, wherein inside the slots (7) vertical tightening teeth (74) are provided, with the aim to reduce the width of the slot in some points .

3. Module according to claim 1, wherein on the rear (4) and front (5) surfaces of the plate protrusions (41) and seats (51) are provided, having a mutually- united shape, in order to ease the alignment of a plurality of plates one to the other.
4. Module according to claim 3, wherein such slots are preferably provided at the protrusions and the seats .
5. Module according to claim 1, wherein in at least one groove (3) of the plate, the module comprises bonding elements (8) for a false ceiling or similar elements .

6. module according to claim 5, wherein such bonding elements are essentially realized by means of a blade, comprising at least one "C" portion (81) for housing the edge of the groove and a little vertical plate (82) extending from one of the horizontal branches of such "C" .

7. Module according to claim 6, wherein the small plate has holes (83) and it remains free inside the groove (3) and when on the ceiling structure, once the concrete has been laid, it creates a stable bond between the plates (2) and the concrete itself in the groove .
8. Module according to claim 6, wherein at the base of such "C" portion a small hole (84) is present, for bonding itself between the element and the plate.
9. Module according to claim 1, wherein the reinforcing element has a "Z" , C, T, I, Ω shape and the groove has a section substantially with the same shape .
10. Module according to claim 1, wherein at each module a height adapter (10) can be associated, having the same sizes of the module and reproducing its upper surface .

11. Module according to claim 10, wherein on the upper surface of the adapter a dovetail guide (11) is provided, corresponding to a longitudinal dovetail guide (23) provided on the upper surface of each module, on the lower surface of the adapter a longitudinal protruding element (12) is provided, having a section for being inserted in the guide (23) of the module or in a guide (11) of another adapter.
